label.caption: Define connection pool configuration
label.name: poolingProfileLabel

integer.description: Controls the maximum number of connections that can be borrowed from the pool at one time. When set to a negative value, there is no limit to the number of connections that may be active at one time. When maxActive is exceeded, the pool is said to be exhausted.
integer.caption: Max active
integer.name: maxActive

integer.description: Controls the maximum number of connections that can sit idle in the pool at any time. When set to a negative value, there is no limit to the number of connections that may be idle at one time.
integer.caption: Max idle
integer.name: maxIdle

enum.description: Determines how connections in a pool should be initialized. The possible values are: INITIALISE_NONE (will not load any connection into the pool on startup), INITIALISE_ONE (will load one initial connection into the pool on startup), or INITIALISE_ALL (will load all connections in the pool on startup)
enum.caption: Initialisation policy
enum.name: initialisationPolicy

enum.description: Specifies the behavior of the connection pool when the pool is exhausted. Possible values are: "WHEN_EXHAUSTED_FAIL", which will throw a NoSuchElementException, "WHEN_EXHAUSTED_WAIT", which will block by invoking Object.wait(long) until a new or idle object is available, or WHEN_EXHAUSTED_GROW, which will create a new connection and return it, essentially making maxActive meaningless. If a positive maxWait value is supplied, it will block for at most that many milliseconds, after which a NoSuchElementException will be thrown. If maxThreadWait is a negative value, it will block indefinitely.
enum.caption: Exhausted action
enum.name: exhaustedAction

integer.description: When exhausted action is Wait (or block) this is the amount of time in milliseconds that the pool will wait before failing. Setting a negative value will block indefinitely until an idle instance becomes available.
integer.caption: Max wait
integer.name: maxWait

integer.description: Determines the minimum amount of time a connection may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction. When non-positive, no connections will be evicted from the pool due to idle time alone.
integer.caption: Min eviction (ms)
integer.name: minEvictionMillis

integer.description: Specifies the number of milliseconds between runs of the connection evictor. When non-positive, no connection evictor is executed.
integer.caption: Eviction check interval (ms)
integer.name: evictionCheckIntervalMillis

label.caption: Define how mule should attempt to handle a connection failure
label.name: connectionLabel

radioBoolean.caption: Do not use a Reconnection strategy
radioBoolean.name: noReconnection

radioBoolean.description: A reconnection strategy that allows the user to configure how many times a reconnection should be attempted and how long to wait between attempts.
radioBoolean.caption: Standard Reconnection
radioBoolean.name: standardReconnection

integer.description: How often (in ms) to reconnect
integer.caption: Frequency (ms)
integer.name: reconnectionFrequency

integer.description: How many reconnection attempts to make
integer.caption: Reconnection Attempts
integer.name: reconnectionAttemps

boolean.description: A reconnection strategy that retries an infinite number of times at the specified frequency.
boolean.caption: Reconnect Forever
boolean.name: reconnectForever

classname.description: A class that implements the RetryPolicyTemplate interface.
classname.caption: Class
classname.name: class

transformer.description: MongoDB is an open source, high-performance, schema-free, document-oriented database that manages collections of BSON documents.
transformer.caption: Mongo DB

string.description: The class of the message generated by the transformer. This is used if transformers are auto-selected and to validate that the transformer returns the correct type. Note that if you need to specify an array type you need postfix the class name with '[]'. For example, if you want return a an Orange[], you set the return class to 'org.mule.tck.testmodels.fruit.Orange[]'.
string.caption: Return Class
string.name: returnClass

boolean.description: Many transformers only accept certain classes. Such transformers are never called with inappropriate input (whatever the value of this attribute). If a transformer forms part of a chain and cannot accept the current message class, this flag controls whether the remaining part of the chain is evaluated. If true, the next transformer is called. If false the chain ends, keeping the result generated up to that point.
boolean.caption: Ignore Bad Input
boolean.name: ignoreBadInput

encoding.description: String encoding used for transformer output.
encoding.caption: Encoding
encoding.name: encoding

enum.description: The mime type of the transformer's output.
enum.caption: Mime Type
enum.name: mimeType

name.description: Identifies the transformer so that other elements can reference it. Required if the transformer is defined at the global level.
name.caption: Name
name.name: name

name.description: Identifies the transformer so that other elements can reference it. Required if the transformer is defined at the global level.
name.caption: Name
name.name: name

name.description: Identifies the transformer so that other elements can reference it. Required if the transformer is defined at the global level.
name.caption: Name
name.name: name

name.description: Identifies the transformer so that other elements can reference it. Required if the transformer is defined at the global level.
name.caption: Name
name.name: name

name.description: Identifies the transformer so that other elements can reference it. Required if the transformer is defined at the global level.
name.caption: Name
name.name: name

name.description: Give a name to this configuration so it can be later referenced by config-ref.
name.caption: Name
name.name: name

string.description: The username to use for authentication. NOTE: Please use a dummy user if you have disabled Mongo authentication.
string.caption: Username
string.name: username

password.description: The password to use for authentication. NOTE: Please use a dummy password if you have disabled Mongo authentication.
password.caption: Password
password.name: password

string.description: Name of the database.
string.caption: Database
string.name: database

string.description: The host of the Mongo server, it can also be a list of comma separated hosts for replicas.
string.caption: Host
string.name: host

integer.description: The connection timeout in milliseconds; this is for establishing the socket connections (open). 0 is default and infinite.
integer.caption: Connect Timeout
integer.name: connectTimeout

integer.description: The number of connections allowed per host (the pool size, per host).
integer.caption: Connections Per Host
integer.name: connectionsPerHost

integer.description: The max wait time for a blocking thread for a connection from the pool in ms.
integer.caption: Max Wait Time
integer.name: maxWaitTime

integer.description: The port of the Mongo server.
integer.caption: Port
integer.name: port

integer.description: The socket timeout. 0 is default and infinite.
integer.caption: Socket Timeout
integer.name: socketTimeout

integer.description: Multiplier for connectionsPerHost for # of threads that can block.
integer.caption: Threads Allowed To Block For Connection Multiplier
integer.name: threadsAllowedToBlockForConnectionMultiplier

boolean.description: This controls whether the system retries automatically on connection errors.
boolean.caption: Auto Connect Retry
boolean.name: autoConnectRetry

globalRef.description: Specify which configuration to use for this invocation.
globalRef.caption: Config Reference
globalRef.name: config-ref

string.description: The name of the collection to update.
string.caption: Collection
string.name: collection

string.description: The query object used to detect the element to update. If the object Id is an instance of ObjectId you need to specify the value pair as map with the following structure: { "_id" : "ObjectId(OBJECT_ID_VALUE)".
string.caption: Query Reference
string.name: query-ref

string.description: The mandatory object that will replace that one which matches the query.
string.caption: Element Reference
string.name: element-ref

enum.description: The write concern used to update.
enum.caption: Write Concern
enum.name: writeConcern

boolean.description: If all or just the first object matching the query will be updated.
boolean.caption: Multi
boolean.name: multi

boolean.description: If the database should create the element if it does not exist.
boolean.caption: Upsert
boolean.name: upsert
